content:
らんぼう〔乱暴〕
〈名〉Violence; outrage; rudeness; roughness; wildness; riot; excesses:(=な) violent (man); outrageous (behaviour); rude (boy); reckless (action); rough (handling); riotous (behaviour); wild (young man); disorderly (manner); unruly (behaviour); rowdy, rowdy-dowdy (person); lawless (people); savage, barbarous (custom); mad (attempt); madcap (escapade); harum-scarum, rantipole (boy); extravagant, exorbitant (price); unreasonable (demands):(=する) to use violence; to resort to violence; to run riot; to commit an outrage; to commit excesses

content.content: (暴行なら)to do an act of violence―commit an outrage―(暴れるのなら)―kick up a shindy―kick up a racket―kick up a rumpus―(暴飲暴食などなら)―commit excesses
酔うと乱暴を働いて困る
When he gets drunk, he will commit excesses―kick up a shindy.
彼らは酒を飲んで乱暴を極めた
They got drunk and committed all sorts of excesses―ran riot.
Young men are wild―Youth is reckless.
僕もあの頃は若かったから乱暴だった
I was a wild young man at that time.
You are a madcap―a huram-scarum―a rantipole.
彼は様子は乱暴だが心は至って好い男だ
He has a rough manner, but is, at bottom' a good fellow.
芋を生まで食うとは乱暴だ
It is savage to eat potatoes raw.
一文無しで旅に出るとは乱暴だ
It is reckless of you to start on a journey without money.
大金を包まずに持って歩くとは乱暴だ、靴下をはかずに靴をはくとは乱暴だ(など)
乱暴な振る舞いをする
to behave in a disorderly manner
to knock things about―bang about anything
The demands are unreasonable―The demands are extravagant.
The price is exorbitant―The price is extravagant.
He is extravagant in spending his money.
to deal out justice in a rough way
乱暴なことをやったものだ
そんな乱暴なことを言っては困る
You must not talk such unreason―talk such nonsense.
そんな乱暴なことを言っては話にならぬ
Such nonsense is out of the question.

content:

content.content: 民衆は乱暴狼藉を極めた
彼は酔うと乱暴狼藉を極める
When he gets drunk, he commits all sorts of excesses―fly out into excesses.
室内は乱暴狼藉を極めていた
The room was in wild disorder―in a devil of a mess.

content:

content.content: The country is in a chaotic state―in a state of anarchy.

content:

content.content: The cherry-blossoms are in all their glory.
The flowers are in full bloom.
The field is decked with all sorts of flowers.
He is as na?ve as a child.

content:
らんみゃく〔乱脈〕
〈名〉Disorder; confusion; chaos

content.content: 会社の内部は実に乱脈だ
The internal affairs of the company are in a chaotic state―at sixes and sevens.
氏の家庭は乱脈を極めている
His household is in utter disorder.
あの先生が入ってから学校が乱脈に陥った
The school has fallen into disorder―fallen into confusion―fallen into chaos―since he entered―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His entrance has thrown the school into disorder―into confusion―into chaos.
会社の乱脈が暴露した
The confusion of the company's affairs have come to light.
内部の乱脈はお話にならぬ
The internal disorder is beyond description.

content:
らんらん〔爛々〕
〈形〉Glaring

らんりん〔乱倫〕
〈名〉Immorality; libertinism

り〔利〕
〈名〉
1. (=利益)good; benefit; advantage; interest:(私の利)self-interest; one's own interests; the main chance:(金銭上の利)gain; profit:(=する) to profit (by something); to benefit (oneself―by something); to derive benefit (from something)

content.content: “Where there is good, there is evil.”
to derive benefit (from something)―(金銭上の利なら)―gain―make a profit―realize a profit―reap profits
to play off one man against another
A sound business yields little profit.
to look to one's interests―consult one's interests―promote one's interests
彼は自分の利をのみ図っている
He only consults his own interests―He has an eye to the main chance only―He only takes care of No.1―He only looks out for No.1.
彼は利を見るに敏なり
He has a quick eyes for the main chance.
to be tempted by the prospect of immediate gain
彼は目前の利に迷って遠大の利を見のがす
He is tempted by the prospect of immediate advantage to overlook future interest.
He runs after immediate advantage―takes a short-sighted policy.
彼は利のためなら何でもする
He will do anything for the sake of gain.
人の利に集まる蟻の甘きに就くが如し
Men are attracted by hope of gain as ants are by sweets.
そこが我れに利のあるところだ
That is where our advantage lies.
the advantage of position―the strength of position―a geographical advantage―a strategic advantage
The advantage of position lies with us.
地の利を占める、地の利に拠る
to occupy an advantageous position―hold vantage-ground
the advantage of union―the strength of union
地の利は人の利に如かず
The strength of position can not prevail over the strength of union.
この学校へ通って利するところがある
I have benefited by attending this school―I have derived benefit from this school―(は文章語、通例は)―I am the better for attending this school―This school has done me good.
この本を読んで利するところがある
I have profited by reading this book―I have read this book with profit―to my profit―I am the better for reading this book―The book has done me good.
君は二三年洋行したら非常に利するところがあるだろう
A few years abroad will do you a world of good.
己を利せんと欲せばまず人を利すべし
If you would benefit yourself, you must first live for others.

content: 2. (=利子)interest

content.content: a low rate of interest―a high rate of interest
彼は利を取って金を貸し付ける
He lends out money at interest.
He lends money at a low rate of interest.
to borrow money at a high rate of interest
一割二分の利で金を借りた
I borrowed money at 12 percent (12%) interest.
公債には五分の利が付く
the five percent bonds―the five percents
証券には日付の日から利が付く
The bond draws interest from its date.
定期預金には六分の利が付く
Six percent interest is paid on fixed deposits.
A loan must be paid with interest.
(悪口なら)利を付けて返上する
I can pay back with interest.
interest at the rate of 2 sen per diem

content: 3. (=勝利)victory

content.content: 鉄砲に刀では利が無い
The sword can not contend against the gun―The sword is powerless against the gun.

content:
り〔理〕
〈名〉
1. (=道理)reason

content.content: その理を解するに苦しむ
I am at a loss to comprehend the reason.
There is some reason in what you say―(を通例略して)―There is something in that.
世人彼を恐るる理無きにあらず
It is not without reason that people fear him―People has good reason to fear him―People may well fear him.
I am amenable to reason―open to conviction.
彼はいくら理を説いても聞き分けぬ
It is no use reasoning with him―He will not listen to reason―come to reason.
この説は理にかなっている
The theory consists with reason―It is consistent with reason.
It is not consistent with reason.
It is contrary to reason―against reason.
負けた者が入費を持つのは理の当然だ
It stands to reason that the vanquished party should pay the expenses.
あの勉強家が成功するのは理の当然だ
It is quite natural that such a hard-working man should succeed―Such a worker ought to succeed.
溢れる人口が出口を求めるのは理の当然だ
It is but natural that an overflowing population should seek an outlet.
The talk becomes serious―takes a serious turn.

content: 2. (=真理)a truth

content.content: There is some truth in what you say―(を略して通例)―There is something in that.
There is only one truth―“Whatever is, is”
理外の理というものがある
It can not possibly be true.

content: 3. (=原理)a principle; a philosophy

content.content: Plato は霊魂不死の理を解く
Plato expounds the philosophy of the immortality of the soul.

content: 4. (=理非の理)right (or wrong)

content.content: どちらに理があるか、どちらが非か
Which is in the right? Which is in the wrong?
The defendant is in the right.
理が非でも彼は言い出した事を通す
Right or wrong, he persists in his statement.
理が非でもその品を手に入れたい
I must have the article by fair means or foul―by hook or by crook―I must needs have the article.
双方に五分の理がある
Much might be said on both sides.
盗人にも三分の理あり

content:
り〔里〕
〈名〉A ri(=2.44 miles)

content.content: 百里行く者は九十九里をもって半ばとす
“There is many a slip betwixt the cup and the lip”
酒屋へ三里豆腐屋へ二里
There is no human habitation within five miles of the place―The place is five miles from anywhere.

りあげ〔利上げ〕
〈名〉
1. (=利子を上げること)raising the rate of interest:(=する) to raise the rate of interest
2. (=質物の利息を払うこと)paying interest on a pawn:(=する) to pay interest on a pawn

content:
りいん〔吏員〕
〈名〉An official

りえき〔利益〕
〈名〉
1. (=益)good; benefit; profit; advantage; interest:(私の利益)self-interest; one's own interests; the main chance:(=する) to profit (by something); to benefit (by something); to derive benefit (from something)

content.content: 何によって利益を得る
to profit by something―benefit by something―derive benefit from something
この学校へ入って利益を得た
I have derived benefit from this school―I have benefited by attending this school―(は文章語、通例は)―I am the better for attending this school―The school has done me good.
この本を読んで利益した
I have profited by reading this book―I have read this book with profit―to my profit―I am the better for reading this book―The book has done me good.
君は二三年も洋行したら非常に利益するだろう
A few years abroad will do you a world of good.
Reading is beneficial―Reading does one good.
そんなことを学んでも何の利益にもならぬ
It does no good to learn such things―There is no good ［no use］ in learning such things―It is no good ［no use］ learning such things.
こんなことを覚えて何の利益になるか
What is the good of―Where is the use of―learning such things?
待った方が君の利益になる
It will be to your advantage to wait.
年寄りの言うことを聴いた方が君の利益になる
It will be to your interests to listen to old folk.
ご利益になるように掛合います
I will negotiate for your advantage.
この取引はきっとご利益になります
The transaction will turn out to your advantage.
It will be advantageous to both sides―mutually advantageous.
相互の利益になるようにはからいます
I shall arrange matters for mutual advantage.
そんなことをしてはかえって君の利益にならぬ
You are acting, not for, but against, your interests.
そんな議論はかえって君の利益にならぬ
Such arguments do not make for, but against, your interests.
to look to one's interests―consult one's interests―promote one's interests
各自の利益を図るべし
Let each man look to his own interests!
彼は一身の利益のみを図る
He only consults his own interests―He has an eye to the main chance only―He only takes care of No.1―He only looks out for No.1.
国家の利益を図るべし
You should look to the interests of your country.
二人はぐるになって互いの利益を図っている
They play into each other's hands.
ばかな大将は敵の利益を図る
A foolish general will play into the enemy's hands.
そんな事業を起こされては我が利益を害する
Such a project will be prejudicial to our interests.
その処置は我が利益に反する
The measure is adverse to our interests.
彼我の利益が相反する
Our interests run counter to theirs.
主義と利益と相反することがある
It sometimes happens that your principles run counter to your interests.
主義と利益と相反する時はどちらを立つべきものか
When one's principles run counter to one's interests, which should one adhere to?
文明国民は己が利益を知る
A civilized people knows its own interests.
人は己が利益を知らぬことがある
A man does not always know his own interests.
彼は利益の存ずるところを知っている
He knows where his interests lie―He knows on which side his bread is buttered.
彼は自分の利益を知らぬ
He is blind to his own interests.
英国は利益に抜け目が無い
England is awake to her interests.
利益を保護するに忙しい
She is busy in looking after her interests.
この地は日本の利益範囲内だ
The place is within Japan's sphere of interest.
僕はあの商会に利益関係がある(株主だ)
I have an interest in that firm.
君と利益交換をしよう

content: 2. (=利得)profit; gain; returns

content.content: 利益を得る、利益を占める
to gain―make a profit―realize a profit―reap profits
彼は多大な利益を得た
He has realized a large profit―reaped large profits―made a good thing.
五百円の利益を得て品物を売った
I sold the goods at a profit of 500 yen.
この商売は利益がある
The business yields much profit―It is profitable―lucrative―It pays.
この商売は多大の利益があるだろう
This business will yield large returns.
多大の利益がありそうだ
堅い商売は利益が薄い
A sound business yields little profit.
この品はいくらも利益がありません
The article yields little profit―I can not make money on this article.
この取引でいくらの利益があったか
What did you make by the transaction?
この鉱山を採掘して利益があるか
Does it pay to work this mine?
彼は利益のためなら何でもする
He will do anything for the sake of gain.
彼は三千円の純利益を得た
差引千円の利益になる
The balance is 1,000 to the good.
君も利益の配当に与るのだ
You will share in the profits.

content: 3. (=法廷の利益)(in) favour (of the plaintiff or defendant):(=の) favourable (to one); in one's favour

content.content: 被告に利益の(原告に不利益の)判決を下す
The judge decides―Decision is given―in favour of the defendant―against the plaintiff.
被告に利益の(原告に不利益の)裁判
decision in favour of the defendant―against the plaintiff
この証拠は君の利益になる
The evidence is in your favour.
君に不利益の証拠は無い
There is no evidence against you.
長引くだけこちらの利益(先方の不利益)
Time is no our favour―against the other party.

content: 4. (=神の利益)a divine favour

content.content: 僕はあの商会に利益関係がある(株主だ)

content:
りえきこうかん〔利益交換〕

content.content: 君と利益交換をしよう
二人はぐるになって利益交換をやっている
They play into each other's hands.

content:
りえん〔梨園〕
〈名〉The stage; the theatre; the theatrical world

content.content: a star of the theatrical world

content:
りえん〔離縁〕
〈名〉
1. Divorce:(=する) to divorce, discard, put away (a wife)
2. (=養子の離縁)dissolution of adoption:(=する) to send back (an adopted son) to his family

りか〔李下〕
〈副〉Under a plum-tree

content.content: I will not compromise my honour.

content:
りかい〔理解〕
〈名〉Understanding; comprehension; apprehension:(=する) to understand; to comprehend; to apprehend; to grasp; to make out (the meaning)

content.content: この子は理解がさとい、理解が鈍い
The boy is quick of apprehension―dull of comprehension.
彼の文章は理解しやすい、理解し難い
His style is easy to understand―hard to understand.
どうしてそんなことができるか僕の理解しあたわざるところである
How such a thing is possible, is above my comprehension―more than I can tell.
人智に理解し得べからざることがある
Some things are incomprehensible to the human mind.
両者間の理解が欠けている
There is a lack of understanding between the two―There is a misunderstanding between the two.
He is a man of understanding―a man of sense.
He has no understanding―He lacks sense.

content:
りがい〔利害〕
〈名〉Advantages and disadvantages; interest; concern; a stake

content.content: to have an interest in anything
日本は支那の治乱に重大なる利害関係を有す
Japan has a vital interest in―a vital concern in―a stake in―China's welfare.
その処置は日本の利害に関する
There is a clash of interests―a conflict of interests.
両者は利害を共にする
They have common interests―A community of interests subsists between the two.
the advantages and disadvantages―the pros and cons―of a policy
この策の利害得失を深く考究しなければならぬ
We must deeply weigh the pros and cons of the measure.

content:
りがい〔理外〕

content.content: 理外の理というものがある

content.content: その方がずっと利方だ

〈名〉The college of science

りがひでも〔理が非でも〕

content.content: 理が非でも彼は言い出した事を通す
Right or wrong, he persists in his statement.
理が非でもこの品を手に入れたい
I must have the article by fair means or foul―by hook or by crook―I must needs have the article.

content:
りかん〔離間〕
〈名〉Alienation; estrangement:(=する) to alienate (father from son); to estrange (friend from friend); to separate, sever (husband and wife); to set (people) at variance; to set (people) at odds; to set (people)by the ears; to poison one's mind against (another); to make mischief

content.content: to alienate father from son and brother from brother
彼は伊藤と僕とを離間しようとした
He tried to estrange me from Ito.
彼は人を離間するのが道楽だ
He takes a malicious pleasure in making mischief―setting people at variance―setting people at odds―setting people by the ears.
女に男の悪口を言って離間しようとする者がある(水を差す者がある)

content:
りかんさく〔離間策〕
〈名〉Mischief-making

content.content: あの男は離間策を用いる

content:
りき〔利器〕
〈名〉
1. (=鋭利な武器)a sharp weapon
2. (=便利な器械)conveniences; facilities; appliances; machinery

content.content: modern conveniences―the facilities of civilization―the appliances of civilization―the machinery of civilization

content:
るす〔留守〕
〈名〉
1. (=不在)absence:(形容詞に用いれば)absent; away from home; not at home; out

content.content: Master is out―not at home―away from home.
He is away on a journey.
役所へ行って留守です
He is away in his office.
海水浴へ行って留守です
He is away at the seaside.
散歩に行って留守です
He is out for a walk.
銃猟に行って留守です
太郎は学校へ行って留守です
用事が有って一日留守にした
I was out all day on business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Business kept me out all day.
人が来たなら留守だと言ってくれ
Should any one call, say I am out―not at home.
to be “not at home” to any one
彼は留守を使って僕に会わなかった
He was not at home to me.
彼は留守とばかりで誰にも会わない
He is never at home to any one.
この前伺った時はお留守でした
The last time I called, I found you out.
家人の留守を窺って泥棒が入った
Taking advantage of the inmates' absence, a burglar broke into the house.
“When the cat is away, the mice will play.”
(時に重きを置けば)while one is absent―during one's absence―(不在の状態に重きを置けば)―when one is absent―in one's absence
留守中誰か来なかったか
Did any one call while I was out?―during my absence?
留守中の出来事で詳しいことは知らぬ
It happened when I was absent―in my absence―and I do not know well about it.
お留守中の出来事は必ずお知らせ申します
I will inform you of whatever happens in your absence.
お留守中は誰が代理しますか
Who will take your place during your absence?
留守中学校を預ってくれる人が欲しい
I want a man to take charge of my school during my absence.
私は校長の留守中学校を預っております
I have charge of the school during the absence of the principal.

content: 3. (=留守番、留守居)caretaking

content.content: 留守をする、留守を預かる
to take care of the house―look after the house―take charge of the house―(during the absence of the master)
家族が海水浴へ行って僕が留守を預っている
The family are away at the seaside, and I have charge of the house―I am left in charge of the house―during their absence.
書生に留守をさして家を出た
I left the house-boy in charge of the house―left the house in the charge of the house-boy.

content:
るすい〔留守居〕
〈名〉(事)caretaking:(人)a caretaker

content.content: to take care of the house―take charge of the house―look after the house―(during the master's absence)
家族は旅行中で僕は留守居をしている
The family are away on a journey, and I have charge of the house―I am left in charge of the house―during their absence.
では今日はお留守居かね
So you are left in charge of the house today?―So you are left behind today?
書生に留守居をさして家を出た
I left the house-boy in charge of the house―left the house in the charge of the house-boy.

content:

〈名〉A decree; an ordinance; a law:(=する) to dictate

れい〔例〕
〈名〉
1. (=慣例)a custom; a usage; wont:(=の) customary; usual; wonted; old; (the person or thing) in question; one of his (lies, etc.)

content.content: 彼は毎日散歩するのが例になっている
It is a custom with him―He makes it a custom―to take a walk every day.
as is usual with him―(を略して)―as usual―as of old
彼は例の如く朝早く起きた
例の如く晩酌をやって寝た
As is usual with him, he took a nightcap before going to bed.
その頃の例の如く彼は十代で結婚した
As was the custom in those days, he married while in his teens.
例によって例の如く彼は酔っておった
He was drunk as per usual.
彼は例の通り抜目無く各方面に運動している
He is making interest with everybody with his usual shrewdness―with his characteristic savoir faire.
例の用心家だから容易に手を出さない
He holds back with his usual prudence―with his customary caution.
Is this the book in question?
また例の癖が始まったね
You are at your old trick again.
It must be one of his stretchers.
例の件はどうなりましたか
What has become of that matter?

content: 2. (=類例)an example; an instance; a parallel:(=する) to give an example; to cite an instance

content.content: to give an example―cite an instance
例を挙げればいくらもある
I might give many examples―cite many instances.
これは多々ある例の一つに過ぎぬ
This is only one instance out of many that might be cited.
日本の進歩は歴史に例が無い
The progress of Japan is without a parallel―unparallelled―in history.
for example―(は人や物、事柄なら)―for instance

content: 3. (=先例)a precedent; a record; an example

content.content: これはこれまで例の無い事件だ
The affair is without precedent―It is an unprecedented affair.
この結果は例を破るものである
The result breaks the record―The result is a record-breaker.
そんなことをすると例になる

content: 4. (=新例)a case

content.content: ここに適当な例がある
Here is a case in point.
例えば本校の如きはその一例である
Our school, for example, is a case in point.

content: 5. (=実例、例証)an illustration

content.content: 歴史にはいくらも例がある
歴史を探って例を求める

content:
れい〔礼〕
〈名〉
1. (=敬礼)a bow; an obeisance; a salute; salutation:(西洋婦人のは)a curtsy

content.content: to bow to one―make a bow to one―make an obeisance to an exalted person―salute one―(西洋婦人なら)―make a curtsy―drop a curtsy
お客様にお礼をなさい
Make a bow to the gentleman!
彼に逢えば礼くらいはする
I am on bowing terms with him―He is a nodding acquaintance.
to take off one's hat―raise one's hat―lift one's hat―to a person
(軍人の様に)手を挙げて礼をする
to touch one's cap to a person

content: 2. (=礼儀)propriety; decorum; politeness; courtesy; civility; breeding; manners; good behaviour

content.content: a man of breeding―a well-bred man
He is an ill-bred fellow―an unmannerly fellow―a churlish fellow―a churl.
彼は長者に対する礼を知っている
He behaves respectfully towards his superiors.
お前は長者に対する礼を知らんのか
Don't you know how to behave towards your superiors?
彼は婦人に対する礼を知っている
He is polite to the ladies.
客人に対する礼を知っている
He is courteous to his guests.
to offend against propriety―sin against decorum
人にそんなことを尋ねては礼に背く
It is against propriety―against the rules of propriety―bad manners―to ask a man such a question.
to be impolite―improper―bad manners―wanting in courtesy

content: 3. (=礼式)ceremony; etiquette

content.content: the New Year's ceremonies―the New Year's greetings
忌中につき年始の礼を欠く
The family being in mourning, the New Year's ceremonies are dispensed with.
旅行中につき年始の礼を欠く
My absence from home on a journey makes it impossible for me to offer my New Year's greetings.
半旗の礼を行う(行っている)
to half-mast the flag―The flag is half-masted―The flag is at half-mast
医者や弁護士には同業者間の礼がある
There is professional etiquette among the physicians and lawyers.
これは同業者間の礼に背いたものである
This is a breach of professional etiquette―a violation of professional etiquette.

content: 4. (=礼遇)honour

content.content: (相当の)礼をもって人を遇する
to do one due honour―receive one with due honour―treat one with due honour
地位相当の礼をもって人を遇する
to do one the honour due to his rank―do one due honour
礼を尽して人を遇する
to treat one with all honour
礼を厚くして招かれた
I was engaged on liberal terms.
彼は人を待つの礼を知らぬ
He does not know how to treat men.

content: 5. (=謝礼、報酬)a present (in acknowledgment of one's services); a reward (for services rendered); a recompense, a remuneration (for one's labours); an honorarium (to a teacher); a fee (to a physician or a lawyer)

content.content: to reward one for one's services―recompense one for one's labours―make one a present in acknowledgment of one's services
to reward one handsomely―give one a handsome reward
I was handsomely rewarded (for my services).
(これは軽少ながら)お礼のしるしまでにさし上げます
I wish to make you a trifling present in token of my gratitude.
これはお骨折りのお礼だからぜひお取り下さい
You must accept the money as a recompense for your labours―in recompense of your labours.
礼を出しても彼はなかなか取らない
I offered him money, but he would not take it.
ここでは医者の礼はいくらくらいしますか
What is the doctor's fee here?

content: 6. (=返礼)a return-present

content.content: お土産を貰ったからなにか礼をしなければなるまい
I must give him something in return for his present.
What shall I give him in return for it?
そればかりの物を貰って礼をするには及ぶまい
You need not give him anything in return for such a trifling gift.

content: 7. (=謝辞、感謝)thanks; acknowledgment; gratitude

content.content: to express one's gratitude―express one's thanks―offer one's thanks―tender one's thanks―return one thanks―thank one―acknowledge a favour
病気中世話になった礼を述べた
I thanked her for her goodness to me in my illness.
今日はご出席下さいまして厚く御礼を申上げます
I thank you cordially―I tender my cordial thanks―Accept my cordial thanks―for your attendance today.
君にお礼を言わなければならない
I must thank you―I owe you thanks.
僕は礼を言われるのが大嫌いだ
なんともお礼の申しようがありません
I can never thank you enough―I know not in what words to thank you―I have no words to express my gratitude―My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.
ご主人によろしくお礼を申し上げておくれ
Return your master my best thanks for the present.
to call on one to thank one
いずれそのうちにお礼に出ます
I shall call on you to offer my thanks one of these days.
直き直き参上御礼可申上候
I shall do myself the honour to wait on you and tender my thanks in person.
